segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, soaking the cabinets and spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, oblivious to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to something, but she’s too distracted to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor if she doesn’t turn it off soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at her to wake up and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR
